column2: Formulate an ontology related to place. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Place a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A geographic or locational entity." .:Country a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." .:City a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A large and significant town." .:Continent a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Continent" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "One of the earth's seven large landmasses." .:River a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "River" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A natural watercourse." .:locatedIn a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a place is located within another place." .:isBordering a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "is bordering" ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that two places share a boundary." .:hasCapital a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City ;    rdfs:comment "The capital city of a country." .    :Germany a :Country ;    rdfs:label "Germany" .:Berlin a :City ;    rdfs:label "Berlin" ;    :locatedIn :Germany .:Berlin :hasCapital :Germany .:Europe a :Continent ;    rdfs:label "Europe" .:Germany :locatedIn :Europe .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: place. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Place a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A place, which can be a physical or geographical location." .:GeographicalFeature a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Geographical Feature" ;    rdfs:comment "A natural feature of the Earth's surface." .:HumanSettlement a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Human Settlement" ;    rdfs:comment "A community where people live and work." .:Country a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." .:City a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :HumanSettlement ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "A large town or populated area." .:River a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :GeographicalFeature ;    rdfs:label "River" ;    rdfs:comment "A large, flowing body of water that usually empties into a sea or ocean." .:Mountain a rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :GeographicalFeature ;    rdfs:label "Mountain" ;    rdfs:comment "A large natural elevation of the Earth's surface." .:hasName a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range xsd:string ;    rdfs:label "has name" ;    rdfs:comment "The name of the place." .:locatedIn a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the location of one place relative to another." .:flowsThrough a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :River ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "flows through" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the places through which a river flows." .:hasAltitude a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Mountain ;    rdfs:range xsd:float ;    rdfs:label "has altitude" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the altitude of the mountain in meters." .:CapitalCity a rdf:Property ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City ;    rdfs:label "capital city" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the city that is the capital of a country." .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: place.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Place rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A general concept representing any location or area." .:Country rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." .:City rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "A large town or incorporated municipality." .:Village rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Village" ;    rdfs:comment "A small community or group of houses in a rural area, larger than a hamlet but smaller than a town." .:Location rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "is located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a place is located within another place." .:hasCapital rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the capital city of a country." .:locatedIn rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies that a place is contained within another place." .```

column2: Formulate an ontology related to place. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix ex: <http://example.org/place#> .ex:Place rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing a geographic or physical location." .ex:Country rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Place ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A political region forming a distinct entity in a geographical location." .ex:City rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Place ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "A large human settlement that is typically more permanent and established than a town." .ex:Village rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Place ;    rdfs:label "Village" ;    rdfs:comment "A small human settlement usually found in rural areas." .ex:Continent rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf ex:Place ;    rdfs:label "Continent" ;    rdfs:comment "A continuous expanse of land forming one of the world's main geographical divisions." .ex:hasCapital rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Country ;    rdfs:range ex:City ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a country to its capital city." .ex:isPartOf rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Place ;    rdfs:range ex:Place ;    rdfs:label "is part of" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that a place is part of another place." .ex:locatedIn rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain ex:Place ;    rdfs:range ex:Country ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Connects a place to the country it is located in." .ex:Europe rdf:type ex:Continent ;    rdfs:label "Europe" .ex:France rdf:type ex:Country ;    ex:isPartOf ex:Europe ;    rdfs:label "France" .ex:Paris rdf:type ex:City ;    ex:locatedIn ex:France ;    ex:isPartOf ex:France ;    ex:hasCapital ex:France ;    rdfs:label "Paris" .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: place. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .@prefix xsd: <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#> .:Place a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A geographical or spatial location." .:Country a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place .:City a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "A large town." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place .:Town a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Town" ;    rdfs:comment "A human settlement smaller than a city." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place .:Village a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Village" ;    rdfs:comment "A clustered human settlement or community, larger than a hamlet." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place .:Mountain a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Mountain" ;    rdfs:comment "A large natural elevation of the earth's surface." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place .:River a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "River" ;    rdfs:comment "A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river." ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place .:LocatedIn a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:label "Located In" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the containing location of the subject place." ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: place.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Place rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A class representing a physical location." .:Country rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A place that is recognized as a country." .:City rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "A large human settlement." .:Latitude rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float> ;    rdfs:label "Latitude" ;    rdfs:comment "The latitude of the place." .:Longitude rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#float> ;    rdfs:label "Longitude" ;    rdfs:comment "The longitude of the place." .:isLocatedIn rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "is located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates a hierarchical geographical relationship." .:hasCapital rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a country to its capital city." .```

column2: Formulate an ontology related to place. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/ontology/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix geo: <http://www.opengis.net/ont/geosparql#> .:Place rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "An entity representing a specific spatial area." .:Country rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." .:City rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A large and densely populated urban area." .:Region rdf:type rdfs:Class ;    rdfs:label "Region" ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A large, indefinite location on the surface of the Earth." .:hasName rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has name" ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:comment "A property denoting the name of a place." .:locatedIn rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "located in" ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:comment "A property indicating that one place is located within another." .:hasCoordinates rdf:type rdf:Property ;    rdfs:label "has coordinates" ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range geo:Geometry ;    rdfs:comment "A property indicating the geographical coordinates of a place." .```

column2: Construct an ontology focused on the following: place. Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Place rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A specific area or location" .:Country rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government and territory" .:City rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "An urban area within a country" .:Continent rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Continent" ;    rdfs:comment "One of the Earth's large landmasses" .:Region rdf:type owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Region" ;    rdfs:comment "An area or division within a country" .:hasCapital rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Country ;    rdfs:range :City ;    rdfs:label "has capital" ;    rdfs:comment "Associates a country with its capital city" .:isLocatedIn rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "is located in" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the place where another place is located" .:isPartOf rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Region ;    rdfs:label "is part of" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates the region a place is part of" .:isSubRegionOf rdf:type owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Region ;    rdfs:range :Region ;    rdfs:label "is sub-region of" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates that one region is a subdivision of another" .:hasPopulation rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#integer> ;    rdfs:label "has population" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the population of a place" .:hasArea rdf:type owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range <http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema#double> ;    rdfs:label "has area" ;    rdfs:comment "Specifies the area of a place in square kilometers" .```

column2: Design an ontology to encompass the following: place.   Provide it in valid Turtle/RDF format, excluding any extra text.
column3: ```turtle@prefix : <http://example.org/place#> .@prefix rdf: <http://www.w3.org/1999/02/22-rdf-syntax-ns#> .@prefix rdfs: <http://www.w3.org/2000/01/rdf-schema#> .@prefix owl: <http://www.w3.org/2002/07/owl#> .:Place a owl:Class ;    rdfs:label "Place" ;    rdfs:comment "A geographical location or area." .:Region a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Region" ;    rdfs:comment "A large area of land that is different from other areas." .:City a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "City" ;    rdfs:comment "A large town or incorporated municipal center." .:Country a owl:Class ;    rdfs:subClassOf :Place ;    rdfs:label "Country" ;    rdfs:comment "A nation with its own government, occupying a particular territory." .:Location a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "location" ;    rdfs:comment "Relates a place to a larger geographical area containing it." .:hasName a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "has name" ;    rdfs:comment "The name of the place." .:PartOf a owl:ObjectProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range :Place ;    rdfs:label "part of" ;    rdfs:comment "Indicates a smaller place that is part of a larger one." .:Population a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "population" ;    rdfs:comment "The population of a place." .:hasArea a owl:DatatypeProperty ;    rdfs:domain :Place ;    rdfs:range rdfs:Literal ;    rdfs:label "has area" ;    rdfs:comment "The total area of the place in square kilometers." .```
